description:
Implement the complete Scribe design system with vanilla-extract tokens, light/dark themes, and primitive components. Migrate all existing CSS (~1000 lines) to token-based styling.

## Overview
The design system establishes a consistent visual language for Scribe with:
- Warm neutral color palette with amber/gold accent (#D9A441)
- Type-safe tokens via vanilla-extract
- 7 primitive components: Surface, Text, Button, Input, List/ListItem, Icon, Overlay
- Light and dark theme support
- Full component migration from plain CSS to token-based styling

## Implementation Phases

### Phase 1: Foundation (linked-25 through linked-31)
- Package setup and Vite integration
- Token contract definition
- Light and dark theme implementations
- ThemeProvider and theme switching
- Raw token values for future React Native support

### Phase 2: Primitives (linked-32 through linked-38)
- Surface, Text, Icon (foundation primitives)
- Button, Input (interactive primitives)
- List/ListItem (selection UIs)
- Overlay/Portal (layering system)

### Phase 3: Command Palette Migration (linked-39)
- Highest-value component migration
- Uses all primitives together
- Delete legacy CommandPalette.css

### Phase 4: Editor Migration (linked-40, linked-41)
- EditorRoot typography and styles
- WikiLinkAutocomplete component

### Phase 5: Remaining Components (linked-42 through linked-45)
- Toast notifications
- BackButton navigation
- ErrorNotification
- Global styles (App.css, index.css)

### Phase 6: Cleanup & Documentation (linked-46 through linked-49)
- Delete all legacy CSS files
- Add visual regression tests
- Dark mode verification
- Update documentation

## Success Metrics
| Metric | Current | Target |
|--------|---------|--------|
| Hardcoded hex colors | 100+ | 0 |
| Hardcoded spacing values | 80+ | 0 |
| Hardcoded font sizes | 30+ | 0 |
| Plain CSS files | 8 | 0 (or 1 reset) |
| Primitive components | 0 | 7 |

## Timeline Estimate

Add IPC handler to search note titles for autocomplete suggestions.

## Details
- Files: 
  - apps/desktop/electron/main/src/main.ts (handler)
  - apps/desktop/electron/preload/src/preload.ts (API)

## IPC Channel: notes:searchTitles

### Input
```typescript
query: string, limit?: number
```

### Output  
```typescript
SearchResult[]
```

### Behavior
- Search metadata.title field only (not content)
- Fuzzy matching using existing search infrastructure
- Return max 10 results by default
- Results sorted by relevance score
- Exclude notes with null/empty titles

## Implementation (using simple substring match for MVP)
```typescript
// Add to main.ts after notes:findByTitle handler
ipcMain.handle('notes:searchTitles', async (_event, query: string, limit = 10) => {
  if (!vault) {
    throw new Error('Vault not initialized');
  }
  
  // Empty query returns empty results
  if (!query.trim()) {
    return [];
  }
  
  const notes = vault.list();
  const lowerQuery = query.toLowerCase();
  
  const matches = notes
    .filter(n => n.metadata.title) // Has title
    .filter(n => n.metadata.title!.toLowerCase().includes(lowerQuery))
    .slice(0, limit)
    .map(n => ({
      id: n.id,
      title: n.metadata.title!,
      snippet: '',
      score: 1,
      matches: []
    }));
  
  return matches;
});
```

```typescript
 * Template-related commands for the command palette.
```

```typescript
    title: 'New Meeting',
    description: 'Create a new meeting note',
    group: 'notes',
    keywords: ['meeting', 'notes', 'agenda', 'sync'],
    closeOnSelect: false,  // Keep open for prompt
    run: async (context) => {
      const title = await context.promptInput('Meeting title');
      if (!title?.trim()) {
        // User cancelled or entered empty title
        return;
      }
      
      context.closePalette();  // Close after getting input
      const note = await window.scribe.meeting.create(title);
      context.navigateToNote(note.id);
    },
  },
];
```

## Command Flow

```
User: cmd+k → types "meeting" or "new meeting"
     → selects "New Meeting" command
     → palette switches to prompt mode
     → user types "Q4 Planning Review"
     → presses Enter
     → palette closes
     → meeting note created and linked to today's daily note
     → editor navigates to new meeting
```

## Validation Behavior

| User Input | Result |
|------------|--------|
| "Q4 Planning" | Creates meeting with that title |
| "  Sprint Review  " | Creates meeting with trimmed title |
| "" (empty) | Command exits without creating |
| Cancel (Escape) | Command exits without creating |

## Important Notes

1. **closeOnSelect: false**: The palette stays open so we can show the prompt. We manually call `closePalette()` after getting valid input.

2. **Validation**: Empty titles are rejected client-side. The IPC handler also validates but the client check provides better UX.
